bio:
Ah, names Domingo Levantus, but 'round these parts, they've dubbed me "Cookie." Now, ya might think it's 'cause of my prowess in the galley, but let me set the record straight – I earned that moniker in a downright bizarre way. Picture this: a night dark as oblivion, our ship besieged by the strangest sea critters you ever laid eyes on. Teeth gnashin', tentacles flailin', they swarmed us like a whirlwind. In that dire hour, I grabbed two trusty rolling pins from the galley and leaped into the fray. With a twirl here and a smack there, I fought off those sea monstrosities with all the grit I could muster. When the dust – or should I say saltwater – settled, the crew, aghast and grateful, called me "Cookie." And that's the name I've worn with pride ever since, a constant reminder of the night I defended our ship with naught but rolling pins.
Now, as for Captain Iron-Hull, I've been his right-hand mate for as long as he's owned that fine vessel. We've had more than our fair share of adventures out on the open sea, and let me spin you a yarn about a handful of those escapades:
The Kraken's Wrath: There was this moonless night when a colossal kraken surged from the depths, its monstrous tentacles threatenin' to squeeze our ship like a lemon. With Captain Iron-Hull at the helm, we fought tooth and nail, drivin' the beast back into the abyss with cannon fire and some daredevil sailin'.
Island of Secrets: On an uncharted isle, we stumbled upon ancient ruins and a hidden old Atmoran treasure hoard. It was a perilous journey, riddled with traps and riddles, but with Captain Iron-Hull leadin' the way, we cracked the code and walked away with the spoils of our adventure.
Storm's Fury: Caught in a tempest that'd make even a seasoned sailor quiver, our ship was tossed about like a piece of driftwood. With Captain Iron-Hull's deft hand and our tireless efforts, we weathered that wicked storm, comin' out on the other side stronger and closer-knit than ever.
Mutiny on the High Seas: There was a time when mutiny reared its ugly head among our crew. But Captain Iron-Hull's leadership and my trusty rollin' pins soon put a stop to that rebellion, remindin' everyone that there's no better captain than the one we already had. Kicked those folk right off the ship and lost about a third of our crew that day. Word is some of them have become bandits not far off in the north.
name: Cookie
